content: Ebola virus disease (Ebola, or EVD) is a severe, often fatal disease first detected in the Democratic Republic of the Congo in 1976. It is spread through contact with infected bodily fluids and has caused a large outbreak in Guinea, Sierra Leone, and Liberia. Nearly 10,000 people have been infected, with almost 5,000 deaths reported.
